title: More Hunting Is Good News for Wildlife Conservation
sub_head: The sale of hunting licenses, tags and stamps is also the primary source of funding for state wildlife agencies.
body:
In “Hunting Aims for a Comeback in Locked-Down Michigan” (Cross Country, Nov. 28), Megan Keller notes that hunters are conservationists of a sort, as wildlife agencies use hunting to control wildlife populations that no longer have normal predators. Not mentioned is that the sale of hunting licenses, tags and stamps is also the primary source of funding for state wildlife agencies. Plus, the Pittman-Robertson Act imposes an 11% tax on the sale of firearms, ammunition and archery equipment, and directs much of the proceeds to fund wildlife conservation. Without hunting, wildlife conservation programs in the U.S. would collapse.
Em. Prof. Thomas J. Straka
Clemson University
Clemson, S.C.
